setup.title: Configure Your Instance
setup.subtitle: Customize the branding and user onboarding experience
setup.displayNameHint: This name appears in the header and onboarding screens
setup.userTypesHint: Define different user types to show type-specific onboarding questions. If you have more than one type, users will choose their type during onboarding.
setup.knowledgeBaseHint: Upload documents to build your RAG knowledge base for AI-powered responses.
setup.databaseHint: View and manage your instance data directly in the SQLite database.

database.subtitle: View and manage SQLite data
database.selectTable: Select a table from the sidebar

fields.globalHint: Global fields are shown to all users. Type-specific fields only appear for that user type.

errors.saveFailed: Failed to save settings. Please try again.

adminOnboarding.title: Admin Setup
adminOnboarding.subtitle: Connect with your Nostr identity to manage this instance
adminOnboarding.installExtension: Install a NIP-07 compatible extension to continue

nostr.whatIsNostrDesc: Nostr is a decentralized protocol for social networking and identity. Unlike traditional logins, your identity isn't controlled by any company — you own your keys.
nostr.whatIsNip07Desc: NIP-07 is a standard that lets websites request your Nostr public key from a browser extension. This means:
nostr.step1: Install a Nostr signing extension (we recommend Alby)
nostr.step3: Approve the connection in your extension
nostr.dontHaveExtension: Don't have a Nostr extension? Get one here:

userType.title: What describes you best?
userType.description: Select the option that best fits your needs
userType.loadError: Failed to load user types. Please try again.

language.subtitle: Select your preferred language to continue
language.changeInSettings: You can change this later in your settings.

adminDashboard.title: Admin Dashboard
adminDashboard.subtitle: Manage your Sanctum instance configuration
adminDashboard.instanceDesc: Customize branding, user types, and onboarding fields
adminDashboard.aiDesc: Configure prompts, LLM parameters, and document defaults
adminDashboard.deploymentDesc: Manage environment settings and service health
adminDashboard.uploadDesc: Add documents to your knowledge base
adminDashboard.databaseDesc: Browse and query the SQLite database

adminAI.title: AI Configuration
adminAI.subtitle: Control how the AI behaves and responds to your users
adminAI.promptTemplateDesc: Shape how the AI communicates with your users
adminAI.promptTemplateHint: These settings define the AI's personality and boundaries. Changes take effect immediately for new conversations.
adminAI.parametersHint: These technical settings affect response speed and quality. The defaults work well for most use cases — only adjust if you notice issues.
adminAI.sessionDefaultsDesc: Set which features are on by default
adminAI.sessionDefaultsHint: Control which AI capabilities are enabled when users start a new chat session.
adminAI.documentDefaultsDesc: Control which documents the AI can reference
adminAI.documentDefaultsHint: Documents marked "Available" can be selected by users. Documents marked "Active by Default" are automatically included in new conversations.

adminDeployment.title: Deployment Configuration
adminDeployment.subtitle: Manage your server connections and infrastructure settings
adminDeployment.serviceHealthHint: Green means the service is responding normally. If a service shows red, check its configuration below.
adminDeployment.leaveEmptyForSecret: Leave empty to keep current value

upload.title: Upload Documents
upload.subtitle: Add documents to your knowledge base for RAG
upload.dropOrBrowse: Drop file here or click to browse

llm.label: AI Provider
llm.hint: Configure which AI service powers your assistant. You'll need an API key from your chosen provider (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic). Changes require a service restart to take effect.

embedding.label: Text Processing
embedding.hint: These settings control how your documents are converted into searchable data. The defaults work well for most cases — only change if you're using a custom model.

email.label: Email Service
email.description: Set up email for user authentication
email.hint: Configure email for sending magic links to users during sign-in. You'll need SMTP credentials from an email service like SendGrid, Mailgun, or your own mail server.

storage.label: Data Storage
storage.hint: Control file paths for the database and uploaded documents. These typically don't need to change unless you're customizing your deployment.

security.label: Security & URLs
security.hint: Set your public URLs and security options. The frontend URL is where users access the app. Make sure these match your actual deployment.

search.label: Web Search
search.hint: Configure the search engine that powers the AI's web search feature. When enabled, the AI can look up current information online.

general.label: General
general.hint: Miscellaneous settings that don't fit into other categories.

prompt_tone.label: Tone & Personality
prompt_tone.description: How the AI should sound when responding
prompt_tone.hint: This sets the overall voice and manner of the AI. For example, you might want it to be "warm and supportive" for a counseling app, or "concise and professional" for a business tool. The AI will use this as guidance for every response.

prompt_rules.label: Behavioral Rules
prompt_rules.description: Specific instructions the AI must follow
prompt_rules.hint: Add rules as a JSON list like ["Always cite sources", "Keep responses under 200 words"]. These are firm guidelines the AI will try to follow in every conversation.

prompt_forbidden.label: Forbidden Topics
prompt_forbidden.description: Topics the AI should decline to discuss
prompt_forbidden.hint: List topics you want the AI to politely redirect away from. For example, ["medical advice", "legal counsel"]. The AI will acknowledge these requests but explain it cannot help with them.

prompt_greeting.label: Response Style
prompt_greeting.description: How the AI structures its responses
prompt_greeting.hint: Controls formatting preferences like whether to use bullet points, headers, or conversational paragraphs. This affects how answers are visually presented.
prompt_greeting.placeholder: Use bullet points for lists, headers for sections...

temperature.label: Creativity Level
temperature.description: How predictable vs. creative the AI responses are
temperature.hint: Lower values (0.0-0.3) make responses more focused and consistent — good for factual Q&A. Higher values (0.7-1.0) make responses more varied and creative — better for brainstorming. Default: 0.7

top_k.label: Knowledge Depth
top_k.description: How many document sections to reference
top_k.hint: When answering questions, the AI searches your uploaded documents and pulls in relevant sections. Higher numbers mean more context but slower responses. Lower numbers are faster but may miss relevant info. Default: 5

web_search_default.label: Web Search
web_search_default.description: Allow AI to search the internet
web_search_default.hint: When enabled, the AI can search the web for current information not in your documents. Disable this if you want responses to only come from your uploaded knowledge base.

LLM_PROVIDER.label: AI Service
LLM_PROVIDER.hint: Choose "maple" for the Maple proxy (recommended for privacy) or "ollama" for local models.

LLM_MODEL.label: Model Name
LLM_MODEL.hint: The model identifier to use (e.g., "kimi-k2-thinking"). Check your provider's documentation for available models.

LLM_API_URL.label: API Endpoint
LLM_API_URL.hint: The base URL for API requests. For Maple: http://maple-proxy:8080/v1. For Ollama: http://localhost:11434.

RAG_TOP_K.label: Context Chunks
RAG_TOP_K.hint: How many document chunks to retrieve for each query. Higher = more context but slower. Default: 8.

PDF_EXTRACT_MODE.label: PDF Processing
PDF_EXTRACT_MODE.hint: "fast" extracts text quickly. "quality" uses OCR for better accuracy with scanned documents but is slower.

EMBEDDING_MODEL.label: Embedding Model
EMBEDDING_MODEL.hint: The HuggingFace model for converting text to vectors. Only change if you need a different language or domain.

SMTP_HOST.label: Mail Server
SMTP_HOST.hint: Your SMTP server address (e.g., smtp.gmail.com, smtp.sendgrid.net).

SMTP_PORT.label: Mail Port
SMTP_PORT.hint: Usually 587 for TLS or 465 for SSL. Check your email provider's settings.

SMTP_USER.label: SMTP Username
SMTP_USER.hint: Your email service username or API key.

SMTP_PASS.label: SMTP Password
SMTP_PASS.hint: Your email service password or API key secret.

SMTP_FROM.label: Sender Address
SMTP_FROM.hint: The "from" address for outgoing emails (e.g., noreply@yourdomain.com).

MOCK_SMTP.label: Test Mode
MOCK_SMTP.hint: When "true", emails are logged instead of sent. Useful for development.

SQLITE_PATH.label: Database File
SQLITE_PATH.hint: Path to the SQLite database file. Default: /data/sanctum.db

UPLOADS_DIR.label: Uploads Folder
UPLOADS_DIR.hint: Directory where uploaded documents are stored. Default: /uploads

QDRANT_HOST.label: Vector DB Host
QDRANT_HOST.hint: Hostname for the Qdrant vector database. Default: qdrant

SEARXNG_URL.label: Search Engine URL
SEARXNG_URL.hint: URL of your SearXNG instance for web search functionality.

FRONTEND_URL.label: App URL
FRONTEND_URL.hint: The public URL where users access the app. Used for generating magic links.

promptPreview.sampleQuestion: What should I know about this topic?
